Title: Integrated Sexual Health Service (C161)
Description:
Rochdale Council acting on behalf of Bury, Oldham and Rochdale Councils (the commissioners) are commissioning an Integrated Sexual Health Service. Bury and Rochdale are also commissioning a 'Young Peoples Sexual Health Support Service' and a 'Young Persons Clinical Service' as part of this service provision  
 
 
The provider will provide an all age integrated sexual health service (including where contractually agreed Bury and Rochdale; the Young Peoples Sexual Health Support Service and Young Peoples Clinical Service) to ensure seamless access for patients requiring contraception and STI testing and treatment services; and providing holistic care to ensure that patients receive the most appropriate treatment and care regardless of the primary reason for presentation. The service will deliver integrated (not simply co-located) provision provided under one management structure. The provider will work in partnership with other locally commissioned services for young people both clinical and non-clinical to maintain and develop homogeneous pathways of care. The provider will provide dual trained nursing staff who can provide both contraceptive and STI care. This provides better patient care as this reduces or removes boundaries between traditional sexual health disciplines. "Dual trained" means that clinical nursing staff will have training in both provision of contraception and management of sexually transmitted infections. The provider will also provide medical consultant staff who are dual trained and/sufficient sessions of medical consultant time to enable both STI and contraceptive service provision to be consultant led.

Organisation Name: NHS ARDEN AND GREATER EAST MIDLANDS COMMISSIONING SUPPORT UNIT
Title: Primary Medical Care Services (APMS) at Cauldwell Medical Centre, Bedford
Description:
NHS Arden and Greater East Midlands CSU (AGCSU), on behalf of NHS England Central Midlands and Bedfordshire CCG (under joint commissioning arrangements) invited suitably qualified and experienced providers to tender for delivery of Primary Medical Services at Cauldwell Medical Centre, Bedford Hospital, Kempston Road, Bedford.

List size is approximately 7,800 actual, 6,600 weighted. Contract value excludes Enhanced Services and QOF payments. 

The contract commenced on 1st July 2017 and will be for a period of 3 years with the option to extend up to a further 2 years (5 years maximum).

Organisation Name: South, Central and West Commissioning Support Unit
Title: NHS E South (South Central) - School Aged Immunisation Service to Lot 1 Bath & North East Somerset and Lot 2 Swindon
Description:
NHS England South (South Central) (the Commissioner) were seeking to commission School Aged Immunisation Service to Lot 1, Bath & North East Somerset and Lot 2, Swindon. The procurement was carried out by NHS South, Central & West Commissioning Support Unit (SCWCSU) on behalf of the Commissioners.

The aim of the School Aged Immunisation Service is to prevent the eligible population, which is defined as any eligible child attending a school, or not attending a school but registered with a GP within the defined geographic boundaries, from developing vaccine preventable childhood diseases that are associated with significant mortality and morbidity.

The contract duration (for both Lots) will be for an initial term of 4 years, with a possible extension period up to afurther 12 months.

The expected service commencement date (for both Lots) is the 1st April 2017. 

The contract was commissioned on a fixed tariff basis.

Title: F12026 Integrated Community Services for North East Hampshire and Farnham CCG and Surrey Heath CCG
Description:
This is a notice to announce the contract award for North East Hampshire and Farnham (NEHF) CCG and Surrey Heath (SH) CCG, with Associate Commissioners (East Berkshire CCG and North Hampshire CCG),  Integrated community Services Contract. 
The commissioned services are organised into three lots covering differing CCG registered populations.
•	Lot 1: This primarily covers the localities of North East Hampshire and Farnham and Surrey Heath CCGs,  the services provided for the Associate Commissioner organisations relate primarily to specific requirements within the community bed service 
•	Lot 2: Applicable to the North East Hampshire and Farnham CCG population only.
•	Lot 3: Applicable to the Surrey Heath CCG population only.
